title: In the Quiet Hours
excerpt:
What lives in the space between heartbeats,
in the breath before speech,
in the pause that holds all possibility?

Time stops here.
Or perhaps it never started.

title: Ordinary Geometry
excerpt:
The angle of winter light.
The slope of a leaf.
The curve of hands holding something precious.

All geometry is love.

title: The Weight of Words
excerpt:
Some words are too heavy to carry.
We set them down gently,
hopping someone will find them
and understand.

title: Before Morning
excerpt:
In that hour
when sleep releases its grip
but waking hasn't fully claimed us,
we exist in a third space—
neither here nor there.

title: Untitled Fragment
excerpt: The unfinished thought is sometimes more beautiful than the complete sentence. It leaves room for your own silence.

title: Slow Accumulation
excerpt: Like snow gathering on a branch, like dust on a shelf, like time itself—beauty often arrives imperceptibly, then all at once is there.

title: The Space Between
excerpt: Between the question and the answer lives the whole truth of us—uncertain, searching, reaching toward understanding.

title: Night Thoughts
excerpt: In darkness we are honest with ourselves in ways daylight doesn't permit. The night asks better questions.
